Name: N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone production | N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: The main production route for methylpyrolidone is the reaction of gamma-Butyrolactone and methylamine. The reaction takes place in a high-pressure tube, with pressure between 6 and 12 MPa. The exothermic reaction requires temperatures between 250 and 400 degrees Celsius. This reaction is often an adiabatic process. The product of this reaction is then decompressed and distilled. The efficiency of the reaction is over 97% (Harreus et al. 2011).
